abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column calls attention to obstruction by New York City Councilwoman Darlene Mealy to idea of establishing community court in Brownsville neighborhood of Brooklyn, idea that is almost uniformly supported by lawmakers in city; notes that similar court in Red Hook neighborhood has led to reduction in recidivism among young people and reduced incarceration.

headline.print_headline: An Obstacle to Progress in Brownsville
headline.main: Standing in the Way of a Community Court in Brooklyn

snippet: For six years, officials have tried to open a court in the Brownsville area to curb incarceration, based on a model in Red Hook. But a City Council member has effectively vetoed it.
lead_paragraph: For six years, officials have tried to open a court in the Brownsville area to curb incarceration, based on a model in Red Hook. But a City Council member has effectively vetoed it.
